an5.294-302:1.1: For the obscure term _māgaṇḍika_, I follow Levman’s suggestion that it is Dravidian  _mā_ (“great”) + _gaṇḍa_ (“hero”), making it equivalent to Mahāvīra. Whether it is simply a Dravidian form for the Jain leader is unclear, for the epithet is not restricted to him; the suttas frequently call the Buddha “great hero”.
